problem.markdown:
Assume we have some theory P. We want to prove that if P holds, then Q happens. We are trying to prove that if theorem P is true the theorem Q is also true. If we did proof by contradiction, which of the following would we want to prove? (x) If P is not true then Q is true ( ) If Q is true then P is true ( ) If P is true then Q is not true ( ) If P is not true then Q is not true
[explanation] Proof by contradiction tries to prove the theorem false. [explanation]
